meanings.definition: defer: to put off or delay
meanings.sent1: She always deferrers her homework until the last minute.
meanings.sent2: The meeting was deferrers to next week due to scheduling conflicts.
meanings.sent3: The cat seemed to be a deferrers, always waiting until the last moment to pounce on its toy.
meanings.sent4: His decision to defer the project was like a ticking time bomb, waiting to explode with unfinished tasks.
meanings.sent5: The deferrers of the train departure made passengers anxious about missing their connections.

meanings.definition: deferrer: one who defers or delays
meanings.sent1: As a deferrers, he often missed out on opportunities by waiting too long to act.
meanings.sent2: The deferrer of the decision caused frustration among the team members.
meanings.sent3: The deferrer of the group was always the last to arrive, making everyone wait.
meanings.sent4: She was known as the deferrer of fun, always hesitant to join in on activities.
meanings.sent5: The deferrer of the payment faced consequences for delaying the bill.
